title: Being penalised by LeaverBuster for involuntary disconnection is financial discrimination.
body:
I understand that it's frustrating when you encounter a large number of disconnections and that somewhere in the agreements to play it must describe that you need a computer capable of running League of Legends, and I understand that Riot is not responsible for people with unstable internet connections. 

However, this is to some degree financial discrimination, you are eliminating from your player base a large section of society who cannot afford to upgrade their computer or their connection. I understand that you have set your own standards for your product and community, but regardless this is still a form of discrimination. 

Additionally, while disconnections are very frustrating at times, I personally feel that if it isn't in a ranked match, that an inconvenience in a videogame is hardly something worth complaining about to the point where you marginalise a section of the players. 

I hope this is not seen as aggressive or accusatory, I just felt a bit strange about the new situation while reading through the changes to the system and the FAQ section. 

Thank you

replies.body:
>However, this is to some degree financial discrimination

You talk like this is a new thing.

> who cannot afford to upgrade their computer or their connection.

This ventures into the realm of why you originally got the computer. It's kinda silly to say, get a computer for work and school purposes (that is, without a graphics card) but still expect it to run games perfectly fine.

I do agree that Leavebuster is exceptionally harsh, but based on the rate that people actually do purposefully leave games, I think we couldn't have it any lesser.

For future reference, rants belong in the Misc boards. This board is specifically to help others with running the game. Are you currently having issues with *your* game?
